concept.title: What You Can Do with gfsh
concept.shortdesc: gfsh supports the administration, debugging, and deployment of processes and applications.

ul.li: Start and stop processes, such as locators and cache servers
Start and stop gateway sender and gateway receiver processes

conbody.p: The gfsh command line interface lets developers spend less time configuring cache instance XML, properties, logs, and statistics. gfsh commands generate reports; capture cluster-wide statistics; and support the export of statistics, logs, and configurations. Like Spring Roo, gfsh features command completion (so you do not have to know the syntax), context-sensitive help, scripting, and the ability to invoke any commands from within an application by using a simple API. The gfsh interface uses JMX/RMI to communicate with processes.
You can connect gfsh to a remote distributed system using the HTTP protocol. See .
By default, the cluster configuration service saves the configuration of your cluster as you create objects using gfsh. You can export this configuration and import it into another cluster. See .
